runs.comm: that's the way to launch a run-chase! Short and aimed at the body, so Marshall swivels into a pull, and deposits Lee in the stands!
a swish and a miss this time. Too much dancing at the crease
fast and straight, but Perkins responds well to the call
outside off, and swinging away. Welcome to international cricket. Perkins hangs out a limp bat, but at least he survived
advancing down the track, and pulled - not entirely convincingly - into space at midwicket. Perkins is off the mark
angled into the pads, and clipped away to fine leg
bonus runs! Short, and climbs steeply off the deck, over the sprawling keeper and away to the boundary
a vast strike! Clobbered high and handsome over deep midwicket. That was an open-shouldered drive, and so sweetly timed
chaotic cricket. A wide, a fumble, a cheeky run, a desperate dive, and more runs for the cause
full length, and an inside-edged drive into the covers
a squawked appeal, but that pitched outside leg. Another run

massive! Massive! That was fetched off a good length with the most monstrous of wind-ups, and that hits the roof of the Greenidge and Haynes stand. West Indies are brawling, as a replacement ball comes out
galloping down the track, and a chancy under-edge, but that'll do for West Indies! No fielder at fine leg, and another boundary to the cause
ballsy cricket! Perkins goes down on one knee, to Lee of all bowlers, and defies all dental appointments by flicking the ball over his shoulder for four!
another cracking stolen single. West Indies are on the ball
down the track to a length delivery, an instant call as midwicket swoops, but he fumbles and they are home
down the track again, Lee responds with a low full-toss, but it's shovelled into the covers
cracked away through the off side, stunning open-shouldered strokeplay!
gave himself room, and walloped it as hard and straight as you can imagine, all along the ground!
neatly tucked off the hip, and that's 17 runs off the over!
length delivery, smacked with a golf swing to deep midwicket
back of a length and dabbed to gully. An instant run, and again the throw goes wide. Australia are under pressure
what a pity. Marshall attempted an improvised paddle, and over-committed himself as the shot went wrong. Watson swooped to field, and threw down the stumps with the batsman stranded
whipped off the hip, a bit of a top edge, but it lands safe at square leg
slower ball, Perkins waits well, and clips to midwicket
slow and short, not quite a bouncer length, but Ramdin waits and thumps it down to third man
outside off and driven hard into the covers
short, and a swing and a miss. Ramdin comes down to have a quiet word. There's no need for that
another dot ball, and a good one too. Good length, and a hint of nip off the pitch
thumped down the ground without much timing, but another run
nice shot, back of a length, and dabbed down to third man
tip-and-run, and that's suicidal. Ponting dives at mid-off, and releases the ball almost before he's gathered it. Perkins goes, but he's done his job.
on the back foot and dabbed down to the gully
a deft steer, clean through the vacant first slip! That's the boundary they've needed. It was another slower ball, and he waited well
the wickets are coming a bit readily now. Ramdin makes room to thump over cover, but Johnson makes good ground at mid-off and completes a neat low catch.
slower ball again, and steered backward of square with a slow-motion pull
cracking delivery, in the channel outside off, and angling in as well. Fletcher is beaten
another slower ball, dabbed to point, to complete a fine over
outside off, and left well alone
quicker ball, but misdirected
another one slides down leg. Not what the skipper ordered
drilled out to point
a beautiful delivery, at last, but it deceives everyone, not least the keeper. Extras are keeping West Indies in the hunt in this over
short, and slapped handsomely over backward square. A rank long-hop, to be honest
better ball. Defended into the covers
a fuller length, and it almost sneaks through. Either way, it's a dot ball
a swing and a miss. Good ball, angling across the right hander
off the mark with a leg-side single
remarkable shot! That was a violent outside edge, one hand came off the bat as well, but the ball cleared Brett Lee at third man by a distance
guided to third man for an intelligent single. West Indies are ahead of the rate this over
full length but outside off, guided to third man for another single
short, banged in towards the gloves, an attempted single is turned down, but they claim one for the rebound as the shy hits the stumps from the gully
jabbed down to third man, singles all over the place now
hit in the groin, but an instant call for the single. Hopes fields well in his followthrough, but Bravo is safely home
up and over the covers handsomely! That was in the slot for the shot, and he went for it well!
pulled out to midwicket. West Indies are all but home and hosed
stand and deliver! That was pitched up towards the blockhole, but Fletcher drove through the line, inside-out, and two bounces into the extra cover advertising hoardings!
an anticlimactic dot to finish the over ...
outside off, and smacked handsomely, gloriously, over deep midwicket for a maximum! What a way to win it!
